data.content: #MediaInvitation: ESAs first planetary defence mission Hera is expected to be launched on a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral NET 7 October, 2024. Journalists are invited to join the European launch event at ESA ESOC, Darmstadt, Germany. Details and registration https://t.co/IxPPXk6CzB
The latest image from the NASA/ESA/CSA James Webb Space Telescope shows the Westerlund 1 open cluster and its exotic stellar population. https://t.co/kvOjWvxMUE
This week's @ESA_EO #EarthFromSpace is a @CopernicusEU #Sentinel2 image showing a mix of landscapesaround Kunshan, a city in eastern China. https://t.co/fm3wrOIRXz
NEWS RELEASE - Forty years of Canadians in space: from the Space Shuttle to the Moon: https://t.co/2VjNKC5Llu

Its World Space Week!  Did you know that satellites help monitor environmental factors like ice melt, sea levels, and forest health from space? These observations are essential in tracking global changes to protect our planet. https://t.co/PCiIBwTZfP

#WorldSpaceWeek starts today! It takes place on the same dates every year  from October 4 to 10  but why? The answer lies in space history @astro_kutryk explains. During #WSW2024, the global space community focuses on climate change. https://t.co/wG0NIvxyoE

SpaceX Will Launch OneWeb Internet Satellites

data.content: LIVE: Tracy Dyson of @NASA_Astronauts discusses her six-month mission supporting science and research on the @Space_Station, and answers questions from the media. https://t.co/QqHcYQLPzc

old_updates.data: In-Orbit Aerospace explores hypersonics under AFWERX contract

data.content: It took @bepicolombo just 30 minutes to map Mercurys magnetic landscape as it sped past the planet during its #MercuryFlyby in 2023: a tantalising taste of what the mission will investigate when it arrives in orbit around the Solar Systems innermost planet. https://t.co/g9dlueBPXg

old_updates.data: Impulse Space wins $34.5 million contract for U.S. Space Force missions

data.content: The @SpaceApps Challenge is happening this weekend, and @Astro_Jenni is here to remind you!  Come put your creativity and talent to good use during the worlds largest global hackathon. You can still register: https://t.co/3mmntNvPqH https://t.co/cv3YzoqNHw

This week the Canadian Human Space Flight Program turns 40! Our "Space Eh!" playlist is perfect to get you in the mood to learn more about the human space missions our astronauts have participated in. Check it out:
https://t.co/fk10otGPxh https://t.co/Oa4SQFAoKc
Congratulations, Ulf!
2024 marks 40 years of Canadian astronauts in space!  Heres a timeline of the past four decades: https://t.co/acoKtzdJFg
LIVE: Our @SpaceX #Crew9 mission launches to the @Space_Station. Liftoff from Cape Canaveral Space Force Station is scheduled for 1:17pm ET (1717 UTC). Questions? Use #AskNASA https://t.co/ShUyD36syY

Ground control to the cosmos, we've got a big day ahead. Not just a regular birthday wish, but a cosmic birthday wish! Happiest of birthday to @nasa & @jaxa_en. 

Cheers to an out-of-this world partnership, lets continue working and exploring together.  https://t.co/sodAiFDSoo
To all educators, the Space Brain Hack is back!  We want you and your class to find ways to lessen the environmental footprint of satellite missions. https://t.co/KzSGJuNA5L

In nearly 70 years of spaceflight, around 10 000 satellites and rocket parts have reentered Earth's atmosphere. Yet for such an event, we still lack a clear view on what actually happens to a satellite during its fiery last moments. https://t.co/1YHfYpxvAY

Our @EuropaClipper spacecraft is sending scienceand poetryto Jupiter's unique moon.

Hear from Ada Limn, U.S. Poet Laureate, and planetary scientist Lynnae Quick Henderson in the latest episode of our Curious Universe podcast: https://t.co/Sd6njwPy9z https://t.co/3LmTyNTRT0

Add a splash of NASA to your desktop or phone with scenes of a water world.

The launch window for @EuropaClipper, our mission to Jupiters ocean moon, opens on Oct. 10. Dive into the excitement with these brand-new wallpapers: https://t.co/7bnPUWBaTv https://t.co/JeraPa2bGF

data.content:
Join the worlds largest annual global hackathon! The NASA @SpaceApps Challenge runs Oct. 4-6.

Watch the live kickoff TODAY at 5pm ET (2100 UTC), featuring special guests from across NASA and space agency partners from around the world: https://t.co/2I6dEjGjpb https://t.co/DtntQ3lUgv

old_updates.data: Vulcan competes second flight despite SRB anomaly

data.content: Week 2 on the road has been a busy one for @Astro_Jeremy! In between a school visit, filming, media interviews and exercise sessions, Jeremy has met with fellow Canadian astronauts and helped celebrate the 40th anniversary of the first spaceflight by a Canadian astronaut. https://t.co/z3VrSz4vUC

#HowToWatch: our @ESA_Hera asteroid mission will soon be launched on a SpaceX Falcon 9 from Cape Canaveral. The launch window opens on 7 October. More details will follow when we receive confirmation of launch date and time. https://t.co/MtyK2Fz2u1

Happy World Space Week!

Today through Oct. 10, follow along with the #WSW2024 theme of "Space & Climate Change" as we share the latest updates from around our @NASAEarth  and across the @NASAUniverse. Learn more about our changing planet: https://t.co/7YEVNhkGrz https://t.co/O5cie0wxEQ
